column4: Im having trouble installing ATI linux drivers under ubuntu 5.10
i searhed google for the error message, not much turned up
root@qix:/usr/share/fglrx# aticonfig
aticonfig: error while loading shared libraries: libfglrx_pp.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
what can i do about it ?
you're missing a library
i kind of guessed that rasput
problem is, where do i get it from, and why ?
probably it's in /usr/local/lib? have a look
i mean, i installed the ati driver set from their site
ok, its there
so why isnt it picking it up ?
/usr/X11R6/lib/libfglrx_pp.so.1.0
its looking for libfglrx_pp.so
Oix: you didn't tell the dynamic linker where it is
nah, its a slightly different name ?
is that the problem ?
yes, that's how shared libs work , the .1 file is a symlink to .1.0
try adding /usr/X11R6/lib to /etc/ld.so.conf and running 'sudo ldconfig'
tx, it worked
cool.
you'll need to do that when you build from source. add the lib/ directory to ld.so.conf and re-run ldconfig
